page.title: 14ROYAL BLIND SCHOOL EDINBURGH
page.content: This school for blind children was founded in 1835 by James Gall. The school joined with the Royal Blind Asylum which was founded in 1793. It is a{boarding school}catering for approximately 110 children aged form 5 to 18, with a variety of difficulties. They do exactly the same subjects as ordinary schools. It is recognised by the Scottish Education Department as the{National {School for the education of the blind {in Scotland.}In 1985 there are pupils from different parts of Scotland. Braille, taperecorders, tape writers, optacons and the Talking Encyclopedia are used. The aim is to provide an environment of mutual love and respect so preparing pupils for life. There are also workshops where a variety of skills are practised and a print shop to make Braille Books.
